name: Hampton Inn Ukiah

reviews.text: The Hampton Inn in Ukiah is by far the best hotel in the area. The rooms are comfortable, very clean, and have all the amenities you need while on the road. The hotel is a little dated and normally that bugs me. I felt very comfortable staying at Hampton because it is very clean and offers excellent service. The Manager, Sarah, as reported by others offers a level service you dont find at other hotels. Thanks Sarah!
reviews.title: Best in Ukiah

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is adequate, its the Hampton Inn, not the Beverly Hilton! Try this place, you'll like it.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, Quality of breakfast foods needs improving though.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Hampton Inn in Ukiah numerous times over the last few years and yes, I realize cut backs are happening everywhere. But the breakfast has gone from just OK, too just plain crappy. Costco type food selections. Old fruit salad, and way too many junky carbs to choose from.. We stay here, and don't mind paying more, as a step up from a typical motel .And we expect more. Also , I used to count on their very warm pool, even for a dip in the dead of winter. What a treat it was too! Now their keeping it way too cold.The bedding and towels smelled heavily of bleach. Come on Hampton, don't cut corners on your faithful! I don't want to stay elsewhere!! Hummmm........Ukiah needs more B & B's, like Cloverdale, Lakeport, etc. do....Smaller towns.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.text: The Red Hawk Restuarant is going to be a nice touch, it's being built right next door.
reviews.title: Quiet Hotel

reviews.text: As a frequent guest of Hampton and Hilton hotels, this one ranks at the top of my list. It is due in no small part by the dedication, and professionalism demonstrated by the property's General Manager, Sarah Noguera. Sarah's infectious attitude is reflected in all of her employees. It has been a very long time since I have been treated as royalty, and Sarah and her team certainly did that. The hotel is extremely clean, quiet, and well managed.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel - best in Ukiah

reviews.text: I suppose this would have been classified as a "Leisure" trip, had we not been in Ukiah to deal with a family emergency. We know this area of town and have always been impressed with the Hilton hotels and inns in general(I am a cardholder). It was therefore easy to decide to stay at the Hampton Inn, right next to the Branches complex (restaurant, pub, bar, deli, pastry shop, market). At the front desk was Ann, who graciously and effortlessly checked us in and gave information. Already, the heavy stress seemed to be lifting. Returning after 6 PM, we went to our room on the third floor overlooking the pool, mountains, and of course Airport Park Blvd. As always, the bed was comfortable and came with two sets of pillows, coffee maker, plenty of space, a good bathroom with separate wash area, and of course the coffee maker. Since a continental breakfast is included in the rate of $117, we didn't need to bother with the coffee machine. Light sleepers may wish to bring earplugs, as occupants in the adjoining room seemed to have their heat on, switching on and off once the temperatures were reached. After a very nice dinner at Branches (superb fish and chips with fresh cod and perfectly prepared hamburger), sleep came easily despite the annoyances next door. Breakfast offers many sweet and fattening items, but at least fresh fruit, yoghurts, cereal provide sustenance. At check-out, Ann was once again to take care of things.
reviews.title: Check this one out!

reviews.text: Why Hampton Inn and not Garden Inn, I asked myself. I suspect that the Hilton Garden Inn has a restaurant and lounge, whereas the Hampton Inn is strategically situated near several restaurants. One peculiarity. Room service is supposed to be offered through Branches, but the only menu available in the room was only for Applebee's. Neither one, it seems, provides room service. This is a minor concern and, along with the thin walls, will not detract from our overall satisfaction. I could give this property four stars but am giving it five because everything worked and the staff handled everything with class.
reviews.title: CLEAN, COMFORTABLE AND FRIENDLY

reviews.text: My family and I have stayed at quite a few different hotels in Ukiah over the last 17 years. I have to honestly say the Hampton Inn is by far the best one. Love the pool (Its the only one my son likes to swim in). The front (and back) staff are great.
reviews.title: So-So
The worst hotel experience I have ever had.
reviews.text: Heidi

I was here on business and I have to say that the outside and common areas of the hotel are great. The may problem was the room. It had a funny smell and the room could use some updating. I stay at Hilton properties for the points and also the quality. This hotel was clean and the staff were very nice but it is do for a remodel. The main problem was the funny smell in my room and the carpet, the carpet looks like it belongs in a Motel 6. The room could use some updating like flat screen T.V.'s, new carpet and lose the wallpaper boarder on the wall. Now overall it was clean and nice but for $129 I expected better. The other two complaints was that there was no HBO, said that they ordered a new dish as the old one broke. I guess the biggest problem was the fan motor on the A/C was loose or broke and I had to get up in the middle of the night and turn it off as it was so loud. Breakfast was good, overall good but not for the price.
reviews.title: BEST Hotel Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fantastic little hotel. The reception staff were genuinely warm and helpful - we were checked in within minutes.
reviews.title: Couldn't fault it - you ARE guaranteed a good night's sleep...

reviews.text: The room istelf is standard HI - quite large and spacious, well maintained and very clean. Lots of nice touches such as the little foot jam on the room door that allows you to get your suitcase into the room without having to struggle to keep the door open. Coffee maker and fridge included and a decent TV with lots of channels. Towels in the bathroom were large, white and thick/fluffy - I liked them. Nice outside pool to the rear of the hotel (enclosed garden). Breakfast area had free tea/coffe al day and breakfast was fine - lots of it, fairly good choice and the whole area kept stocked and clean. Couldn't fault it.
reviews.title: One of the Nicer Hamptons I've Stayed In

reviews.text: We had some neighbours in the next room who had there TV on very loud (I think they were deaf) I called reception and they immediately offered to either a) talk to the other guests or b) move us. I opted for the latter and we were asked (without any hesitation) to gather out belongings and they would advise us which room to move to. Within about 3 minutes the man from reception arrived at our door with new room keys - supurb service and all done with a genuine smile. I was honestly impressed as we were made to feel like we were being bothersome.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Ukiah

reviews.text: The hotel management certainly know how to empower their staff. In return, their staff are a credit to themselves and the hotel - I would recommend this hitel without hesitation.
reviews.title: Handsome, comfortable property
Convenient - will stay again!
reviews.text: 5 stars and thank you Hampton Inn Ukiah.

I've stayed at this hotel on several trips through Ukiah after my first visit. It's only about a minute off the freeway. The service was quick if I've needed something in my room and they're always pleasant and proffessional. The rooms are comfortably furnished, fresh smelling linens with all the amenities I needed. The coffee unit could use an upgrade though.
reviews.title: Quiet and relaxing

reviews.text: The complimentary breakfasts are pretty healthy for those looking to stay on track while away from home. There's restaurants across the street and a Starbuck's for the coffee junkies! There's also a nice home center down the road!
reviews.title: Superb value, neat as a pin, nice ammenties, and service with a smile - Hampton Inn, Ukiah has it all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having just spent the night at an impossibly bad hotel in Eureka, my daughter and I decided to cancel the remainder of our reserveration, and hit the road to take our chances on finding another hotel en route to San Francisco. We lucked upon the Hampton Inn in Ukiah. It was, quite simply, the best hotel we stayed in during our entire trip - including much more expensive B&Bs in Mendocino and Ferndale The Ukiah Hampton Inn was spotless, the rooms were spacious and nicely appointed (granite counters on the double sinks, microwave/fridge, flat-screen TV, gourmet coffee w/ single serve machines, private balconies, etc.), the beds were very comfortable (firm/supportive with down comforters and silky sheets), the grounds were beautiful (large, heated outdoor pool, mature trees, and a waterfall that ended in a koi pond). Every staff person -from the night desk man, to the hall maid - greeted us with a "hello" and a smile. And the manager - Sara Noguera - was exceptionally gracious and professional (even calling ahead to the Hampton Inn at the SFO airport to reserve another room for us for the next night!). If you plan to tour wine country north of San Francisco or are on your way further north on Highway 101 and need a great place to stay on a budget - you can't do better than Ukiah Hampton Inn!
reviews.title: Room was wonderful, view from balcony not the best.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time on our wedding night with the hot tub next to the comfortable king size bed with down comforter and pillows. Romantic fireplace and very spacious room with a nice little balcony for two. The fish pond and courtyard with pool were beautiful at night but the landscape beyond the hotel fence was a field of brown weeds and the roof over the entrance to the courtyard cut the view of the pool out and some of the pond. If you don't get a suite then you probably wouldn't have that problem. Overall it was the best hotel I had ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Plush, but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's one of the best Motels we have stayed at, and the breakfast one of the best also (with the possible exception of the Ibis in Chartres).
reviews.title: First choice in Ukiah

description: Savor the past and indulge in the moment when you visit the Hampton Inn® Ukiah hotel, with its Victorian-style architecture set against the picturesque backdrop of the California Tuscany region in Mendocino wine country. Ukiah's mild Mediterranean climate makes it easy to savor the serenity and flavor of this eclectic community situated at the gateway to the Redwood Forest. Indulge in any of the forty world-renowned wineries and grape vineyards within a short drive of our Ukiah hotel. Relax as you bathe in champagne at Ukiah's naturally carbonated, hot mineral baths (a favorite hot-spot of writer Jack London) near the hotel. Seek outdoor thrills like fishing and camping at Lake Mendocino, the spectacular Redwood Forests, and the many nearby state parks; soak in the culture at the Grace Hudson Museum and Sun House, Solar Living Institute or Pomo Indian Cultural Center; or get your juices flowing at the Ukiah Speedway, all within minutes of this peaceful Ukiah hotel.
